  • Constructor Details

    • LinearCalculator

      public LinearCalculator(String coordinate1, String coordinate2)
      A constructor that creates an instance of the LinearCalculator. Takes a string argument and uses parse int to separate to two intergers per coordinate.

      PRECONDITION: The coordinates are in the string formula "(x,y)", where x and y is an interger.

      Parameters:
      coordinate1 - The first coordinate point
      coordinate2 - The second coordinate point

    • distance

      public double distance()
      Calculates the distance between the two points to the nearest hundredth using the distance formula
      Returns:
      The distance between two points

    • yInt

      public double yInt()
      Returns the y-intercept of the line created by the two points rounded to the nearest hundredth. This is done using the slope and the point-slope form formula.

      If the y-intercept is undefined, the function returns -999.99 instead. This only happens when the line is a vertical line, which means the slope is undefined. If the slope is undefined, the y-intercept is also undefined.

      Returns:
      The y-intercept of the line created by the two points

    • slope

      public double slope()
      Returns the slope of the line created by the two points rounded to the nearest hundredth. Employs the slope forumla.

      If the slope is undefined, the method will return -999.99 instead. The slope is undefined when the denominator, (x2 - x1), equals 0.

      Returns:
      The slope of the line created by the two points

    • equation

      public String equation()
      This method returns a String representing the equation of the line created by the two points in y=mx+b form. If the slope is undefined, the equation will also be undefined.

      After calculating the slope and y-intercept, the code will check if either is equal to zero. If true, then it will not be added to the equation. In addition, it will also check whether the y-intercept is positive or negative. And then add the corresponding signs in the final equation.

      Returns:
      The equation of the line

    • roundedToHundredth

      public double roundedToHundredth(double x)
      Takes a double and rounds it to the nearest hundredth.
      Parameters:
      x - The number that needs to be rounded
      Returns:
      The number rounded to the nearest hundredth.

    • printInfo

      public String printInfo()
      Stores the information about the two points and the line that they create. Includes the points and the equation, slope, y-intercept, midpoint of the line. Also checks whether the points are symetric and finds the distance between the points
      Returns:
      The information to be printed.

    • findSymmetry

      public String findSymmetry()
      Finds whether there is symmetry between the two points.

      First finds the midpoint coordinate. Checks the x and y of the midpoint to see if they are symmetric about the x-axis, y-axis, origin or have no symmetry.

      Returns:
      The symmetry of the two points in String

    • Midpoint

      public String Midpoint()
      Finds the midpoint are returns it in "(x,y)" where x and y are coordinates of the midpoint.
      Returns:
      The midpoint
